alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 3:39PM MDT until June 29 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES...SPECIFICALLY FOR SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF ZION NATIONAL PARK. At 339 PM MDT, Park Rangers at Zion National Park reported flash flooding occurring in both Spry Canyon and Pine Creek. Radar estimates of .30-.40 inches fell very rapidly across these areas from earlier thunderstorms HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of slot canyons, creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park and Springdale...specifically Spry Canyon, Shelf Canyon, Pine Creek, Lower Clear Creek, and Keyhole Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Flooding is occurring. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid slot canyons, streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
